text: The Story So Far is the third album by the Tewkesbury ska punk band Spunge. It was released on 26 August 2002 on the B-Unique Records label and recorded at two studios, Sawmills and Jacobs. The record was produced by John Cornfield (Supergrass, Muse) and Chris Sheldon (Foo Fighters, Therapy?). The album perhaps marks a change in the band's sound, from a more laid-back ska style to a more rock sound. Two singles, "Jump on Demand" and "Roots", were released from the album.. The Story So Far includes a new version of the single "Ego", from Room For Abuse. ==Track listing== # "The Story So Far" – 4:16 # "Roots" – 3:51 # "Give It A Try" – 2:34 # "Change of Scene" – 3:25 # "Skanking Song" – 2:23 # "Dotted Line" – 3:28 # "Ego" – 3:05 # "Jump on Demand" – 3:35 # "It's Over" – 2:41 # "Friend Called Fred" – 3:55 # "Too Little Too Late" – 3:59 Category:2002 albums Category:Spunge albums Category:Albums produced by John Cornfield
title: The Story So Far (Spunge album)
